p: Epidemic curves in Figure 1 show the temporal distribution of the weekly incidence of three influenza viruses (A/H1N1, A/H3N2 B) from 2010 to 2019. The epidemic curve for each virus type shows the various shapes each year, and there is no specific multi-year trend for any single virus type. Among the nine seasons, A/H3N2 predominated in six seasons, A/H1N1 was predominant in three seasons and B was predominant during one season (2017â€“2018).
